summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Communications Technician from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview was conducted as part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York. The document lists attachments including the interview transcript and related emails and records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; he died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.

persons.context: Conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP Communications Technician along with an ASAC.

connections.description: ASAC, along with a Special Agent, conducted a voluntary interview of the Communications Technician as part of the OIG investigation.
Special Agent, along with an ASAC, conducted a voluntary interview of the Communications Technician as part of the OIG investigation.
The Communications Technician was an Electronics Technician at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Communications Technician
events.description: Assistant Special Agent in Charge (ASAC) and a Special Agent from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of a BOP Communications Technician from MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Lieutenant's Memorandum
events.description: A memorandum was written by a Lieutenant at MCC New York; it is attached to the OIG report.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, inmate register number 76318-054, died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, prompting an OIG investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of a BOP Communications Technician from MCC New York as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The interviewed individual was the Electronics Technician at MCC New York when Epstein was housed there.
The interview was recorded and transcribed on April 7, 2022.
The report includes multiple email attachments from 2019 regarding camera systems, deliveries, and technical issues at MCC New York.
The document is labeled 'LIMITED OFFICIAL USE' and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG.
